tweets.html:
The fact that people care about Kim Kardashian's wedding proves why we have to write "Do Not Eat" on silica gel packets

— Brad Williams (@funnybrad) May 24, 2014

Dear @NBCHannibal producers: Just go ahead and bring in Brian DePalma next season. You know you want to.

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) May 26, 2014

A really good way to ruin literature for yourself is to try & imagine that the male protagonist is Perry Farrell in that tequila commercial…

— Anthony Crupi (@crupicrupicrupi) May 25, 2014

This has been the best week for scripted television since I became a TV critic. One milestone episode after another.

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) May 26, 2014

I mean, #Fargo and #TheAmericans and #MadMen and #Hannibal and #OrphanBlack and #Louie just THIS week? Holy shit, people, we're spoiled.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) May 26, 2014

Since there's no new "Game of Thrones" tonight I guess I'll have to call my sister and start hitting on her.

— Ben Siemon (@BenjaminJS) May 26, 2014

Oh awesome, I thought there was no new Game Of Thrones tonight! pic.twitter.com/kCoAd1oH3D

— Dan Hopper (@DanHopp) May 26, 2014

No Game of Thrones tonight? Why is HBO acting like Network TV and taking the week off? #ItsNotOkayItsHBO

— ishira kumar (@ishirakumar) May 26, 2014

"Your next call is going to be from Pete Campbell." Jim Cutler knows how to lay down a threat, son. #MadMen

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) May 26, 2014

In Ted’s defense Claremont IS a fairly good place for smoldering wreckage. #MadMen

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) May 26, 2014

I think I speak for all #MadMen fans when I say, "Be quiet, Sean." You're the worst, and I say that after a half-season of Lou.

— Chris Serico (@ChrisSerico) May 26, 2014

No spoilers but Julio is the best final-season character since Hearst.

— Brandon 🚷 (@bnowalk) May 26, 2014

I hope Harry Hamlin never gets tired of playing characters who ruin the lives of others when they least expect it. #MadMen #VeronicaMars

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) May 26, 2014

Ken's smile when Joan tells Harry is he isn't a partner yet is my everything #MadMen

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) May 26, 2014

Not crazy about Joan's position in this debate but I have NO QUARREL with that dress. #MadMen

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) May 26, 2014

Joan, what is your damage? #MadMen

— Meredith Blake (@MeredithBlake) May 26, 2014

In 2015, we'll get the flashback ep that explains why Joan is THIS MAD. #MadMen

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) May 26, 2014

I just realized this means they let Kellie Martin out of the Hallmark ghetto. Miracles happen, people. #MadMen

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) May 26, 2014

Mad Men spin-off where Don Draper and Jennifer Love Hewitt communicate with ghosts.

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) May 26, 2014

Very sad for Peggy that the technology for her to text pics of both outfits to Joan is like forty years away. #MadMen

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) May 26, 2014

To me, Vincent Kartheiser's sacrifice of his hairline is the defining martyrdom of the twenty-first century. #MadMen

— Scaremy Jingleghost (@JeremyMonjo) May 26, 2014

I would like to collect all of the awards in a bucket and dump them on Elisabeth Moss's dumb perfect head. #MadMen

— Kayla Kumari Upadhyaya (@KaylaKumari) May 26, 2014

Pfff if this is such a big moment then why aren't any of them live-tweeting it? #MadMen

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) May 26, 2014

Somewhere out there during this montage, Duck Phillips is unplugging a TV. Godspeed. #MadMen

— Scaremy Jingleghost (@JeremyMonjo) May 26, 2014

"Y'all care about the Moon, but y'all can't care about the problems here on Earth?" - Sally & Sean acting like they're on Twitter. #MadMen

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) May 26, 2014

I am VERY offended by the radical anti-TV message of the past two episodes. Eat burgers? Look through a telescope? TV IS BETTER. #MadMen

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) May 26, 2014

I do love that Don can give a look and Pete Campbell knows the ins, outs and in-between. I'm gonna miss them. #blowsnose #madmen

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) May 26, 2014

HE. OPENED. HER. BEER. FOR. HER. THEN. SWITCHED. LIKE. HE. WAS. WAITING. FOR. HER. TO. GRAB. IT. #imokay #madmen #thatsbetterthanlastweek

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) May 26, 2014

AND. THEN. HE. PUSHED. ON. HER. SHOULDER. WITH. HIS. SHOULDER. YOU GUYSSSSSSS. I CAN'T FEEL MY LEGS. #madmen #oooooooooooooooohhhhhhhdon

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) May 26, 2014

That secret, shared smile. That's why I watch TV. #MadMen

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) May 26, 2014

Vaguely curious if next ep of #MadMen covers my birth.

— 🎄manda B🎁wer (@heyprofbow) May 26, 2014

Wait, have we spent sufficient time discussing Kellie Martin? Because I must have missed that. KELLIE MARTIN. #MadMen

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) May 26, 2014

Peggy. Olson. #MadMen

— Alan Sepinwall (@sepinwall) May 26, 2014

Peggy Olson's Carousel. #MadMen

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) May 26, 2014

Peggy we love you so much right now. #MadMen

— Tom & Lorenzo (@tomandlorenzo) May 26, 2014

Sorry Alicia Florrick. But Peggy Olson just stole all of the awards. #MadMen

— ishira kumar (@ishirakumar) May 26, 2014

Burger Chef turned into Buffalo Wild Wings in 2010, and everyone associated with the chain eventually was convicted for fixing NFL games.

— Anthony Crupi (@crupicrupicrupi) May 26, 2014

Peggy Olson wins the Nobel Prize for Burgers and not five minutes later Mark Wahlberg finds a Transformer. What an age we live in.

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) May 26, 2014

Mark Wahlberg saying "I think we just found a Transformer" is my everything sorry guys.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) May 26, 2014

Oberyn Martell: "I will be your champion."
Tyrion Lannister: "Forget that - I want Peggy Olson."

— Dave Itzkoff (@ditzkoff) May 26, 2014

"That's good, because that's the name of the spot." PEGGY OLSEN and her smirk just dropping the mic like it's any old Thursday. #MadMen

— Whitney McIntosh (@WhitneyM02) May 26, 2014

Roger. Sterling. #MadMen #SOGood

— Alan Sepinwall (@sepinwall) May 26, 2014

Hey there Dawn. It's been awhile. Glad to see you for like…1 second. See you next year! #madmen

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) May 26, 2014

Real talk: the way Don says coupons. Not having it. #MadMen

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) May 26, 2014

Let me back up to something. That dress with the buttons right above Peggy's chest? WHAT WAS THAT ABOUT? I NEED ANSWERS. #madmen

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) May 26, 2014

No one gets an anvil dropped on him like Harry Crane.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) May 26, 2014

Oh my goodness. This is PERFECT. #MadMen

— Alan Sepinwall (@sepinwall) May 26, 2014

Did Don take another shot of speed to the ass and can I have some too? #MadMen

— Whitney McIntosh (@WhitneyM02) May 26, 2014

Bert’s dry cleaner got the mustard out!

— David T. Cole (@Glark) May 26, 2014

HE'S IN HIS SOCKS. #MadMen

— Matt Mitovich (@MattMitovich) May 26, 2014

Really hope next year opens with a musical montage of Peggy & the kid running around to Paul Simon’s “Me and Julio Down By the Schoolyard”

— Nick Chaney (@NickJChaney) May 26, 2014

ON THE NEXT MAD MEN: Don gets Michigan J. Frog'd again, hopefully!

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) May 26, 2014

Mad Men is the only show that can borderline endear me to an open racist by way of a song and dance number.

— Michael Neal (@slapclap) May 26, 2014

If Matt Weiner created Mad Men entirely so he could set up that moment, that would pretty much have been worth it.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) May 26, 2014

Before you die you see a Bert Cooper soft-shoe. #MadMen

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) May 26, 2014

Weiner: "and this is how we will end the midseason finale of #MadMen."
AMC Exec: "that's great, but have you considered 'Sweet Dreams?'"

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) May 26, 2014

Bert Cooper can bring whole cities to ruin...

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) May 26, 2014

I think I would've liked Breaking Bad more if season 5a ended with Jonathan Banks singing "Diamonds are a Girl's Best Friend"

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) May 26, 2014

tweets.author_name: Motion to Strike: Soldier in the War on Christmas
tweets.html:
The policy on #MadMen is that when a character dies, the actor can choose whatever he wants for his final scene. I'm guessing.

— Motion to Strike: Soldier in the War on Christmas (@MotionToStrike) May 26, 2014

Mad Men finale, without commentary or spoilers. pic.twitter.com/c7FK2L51SO

— Michael O'Connell (@mikeylikestv) May 26, 2014

Next Time on Mad Men: "You only have 7 hours of your life where you'll have to watch AMC ever again"

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) May 26, 2014

"The only non-murderous drama on TV will return in 2015."

— Brandon 🚷 (@bnowalk) May 26, 2014
